特記事項: 【合併】Seminar in International Human Rights and Humanitarian Principles　（大学院共通科目・認定科目前期）/Seminar in International Human Rights and Humanitarian Principles　（経営戦略研究科）
関連科目: Career seminar for International Organizations, Management of International Organizations, Internship in the United Nations
授業方法: The seminar will be conducted face to face on campus in principle.  However, when there are students who cannot physically come to campus due to restrictive measures taken against the pandemic, sessions will be conducted in hybrid manner that employ interactive online schooling.

第1回:
(9/21)  Introduction and overview of the course (Shimizu)
1) Understanding objectives and structure of the course
2) Exploring your own experiences on human rights
3) Understanding human rights norms and principles
Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on her/his experiences on this course.
第2回:
(9/28) UN and human rights (Miwa)
1) UN and human rights
2) UN Charter
3) Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR)
Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
第3回:
(10/5) Treaty bodies and their implementation mechanisms (Miwa)
1) 9 core human rights treaties and their committees
2) Concluding observations
3) Individual communication
Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on one of the 9 core human rights treaties.
第4回: (10/12) Mission, responsibilities, contributions and challenges of treaty committees: Guest speaker to be invited. (Miwa)
Assignment will be notified prior to the class.
第5回:
(10/19) Human Rights Council (Miwa)
1) Roles and functions of Human Rights Council
2) Universal Periodic Review (UPR)
Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on Universal Periodic Review (UPR) and its functions.
第6回:
(10/26) UN and disability (Nishino)
1) How disability has been regarded in international settings and the UN.
2) Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (CRPD)
3) Case study discussion: Students are expected to actively participate in group and class discussions.
第7回:
(11/2) Internaional Humanitarian Laws (Akahoshi)
1) Historical development of international humanitarian laws (IHLs) and International Committee of the Red-Cross (ICRC)
2) Applying IHLs to a specific conflict situation

Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on international humanitarian laws (IHLs)

Suggested reading:
https://www.icrc.org/en/document/rules-war-why-they-matter
第8回:
(11/9) UNHCR: Mandate and the international protection of refugees  (Shimizu)
1)Mandate of UNHCR
2)Historical development of the international protection of refugees
3) International protection of refugees
Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on UNHCR mandate.
第9回:
(11/14) UNHCR: Applying human rights and humanitarian principles for refugee assistance (Shimizu)
1)UNHCR principles in programming the concept of protection -AGDM
2) International protection of refugees and human rights laws
3)Applying the humanitarian principles to refugee situations
Assignment: Each student prepare one-page report on the international protection of refugees
第10回:
(11/23) Humanitarian principles (Akahoshi)
1) Historical development of humanitarian principles
2) Application of humanitarian principles

Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on humanitarian principles

Suggested reading:
https://www.unocha.org/themes
第11回:
(11/30) A principled approach to humanitarian action (Kukita)
1) UNICEF’s perspective working in complex emergencies
2) Child rights-based approach and humanitarian support to children
3) Core commitment for children
4) Child soldiers
5) UNICEF’s cluster responsibilities
Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on special considerations in taking humanitarian support to children.
第12回: (12/7) Guest: Former member of UNHCR or other UN agencies (Shimizu)
Post-seminar assignment: Reflections on the lecture given by the quest speaker
第13回:
(12/14) Reflecting the course and preparing for the term paper (Shimizu)
1) Reflecting the course
2) Discussion on issues raised
3) Preparing for the term paper

Assignment: Each student prepares one-page report on (1) what she/he has learned in the seminar and (2) an outline of the term paper on a specific theme/topic of human rights or humanitarian issues with its title, research question, and structure.
第14回:
(12/23) Conclusion (Shimizu)
1) Presentation by each student of the term paper
2) Evaluation of the course
Assignment: Each student makes a presentation on her/his term paper.
